@marymurrah @senorrinhatch Again, I don't see this as contrarian. I'm not saying "OMG, Fox News was right, the tan suit denigrated the Presidency and is probably proof Obama's a Muslim." I'm saying "Obama made poor shirt and tie choices with a tan suit, Mitch made good ones."
@marymurrah @senorrinhatch I just don't see it that way. I reject the premise that I'm required to criticize Mitch McConnell before praising his summer tailoring choices.
@marymurrah @senorrinhatch If you said it was "wrong" I'd understand, though disagree. I just don't see the "praising McConnell's suit choice = hating minorities" connection.
@marymurrah No it isn't. This is a definition of racism so broad as to be useless. You're using it as a euphemism for "political opinion I dislike"

@marymurrah I just don't agree that, because racists criticized Obama's tan suit, it is racist to criticize Obama's tan suit. I mean, I don't think it's a reflection on his Presidency, I think it's a reflection on his taste in clothing.

@marymurrah Judging men's tailored clothing is, in my opinion, my greatest expertise. I thought Hillary would win an electoral landslide in 2016; never thought button-down collars were acceptable underneath hard-finished dark suits.
@marymurrah Anyone who has heard me talk about tan jackets knows I recommend blue shirts and contrasting ties. An opinion shared, if it matters, by Esquire: https://t.co/54sEsqBl3Q
@michaelZfox You better get admitted to the Louisiana bar and start a rural practice.

This could be a "how to wear tan" comparison. McConnell smartly opts for a light blue shirt and contrasting tie, that isn't overly saturated because it's against a blue shirt. A full standard deviation better than Obama's choice. https://t.co/qAhXtsoeKU
@michaelZfox That's one day a year. An unlined linen suit in a light color is a far better summertime look than seersucker. Much less costume-like.

McConnell is an underrated dresser. Lots of contrast collars, high quality tailoring (handcut pockets, good lapel roll = quality suit), plus he knows blue shirts look better under lighter tans than white shirts. #SartorialSolon https://t.co/U5PT3I9Dc6

Don't get me wrong, there's plenty of times the commuter rail is fantastic (the T almost never) but most of these are solvable problems, and it's hard to take seriously the never-ending calls for more money when they can't get basic things right.
Or maybe it's having all of those happen in one trip. Paying $23 round trip is a bargain for a comfortable, reliable experience — for this it's highway robbery.

@andrewside89 @Alex_Roarty It's a lot harder than IL, but doable for someone with the money and organizational strength Crowley wields. Powerful incumbents almost always need to be both 1) ideologically out of step and 2) complacent to lose primaries.
@andrewside89 @Alex_Roarty New York has similar rules to MS. Not nearly as easy as IL, but not impossible.
@Alex_Roarty Cochran used a similar strategy (masterminded by the Barbours) to stave off the Tea Party challenger by getting Dem and independent votes.
@Alex_Roarty Lipinski, like Thad Cochran in MS, had a strategy to expand the primary electorate with moderate Dems, unenrolled and even Republican voters. Crowley clearly didn't.

@Hirschfeld4VA Many people, myself included, don't view illegal immigrants seeking a better life as the equivalent to rapists, drug dealers, and murders who are separated from their children while in prison. Not all crimes are created equal.

@Hirschfeld4VA The outrage is intrinsic in separating parents from children and keeping the children in crowded, substandard detention facilities. There's a basic human reaction to want mothers and fathers to be able to see, hold, and love their children.
